entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2502
entry.content:
Welcome to the release update blog of SAP Asset Performance Management for 2502. We're excited to share various enhancements in Asset Risk Management, Asset Reliability Engineering, Asset Data and Information Management, and Asset Health Monitoring that we believe will greatly improve your experience. Here's a list of the most important innovations:

  • Assign failure mode to Risk & Criticality Assessments
  • Displaying additional details such as 'Maintenance Plant', 'Planning Plant' on technical objects
    in Risk & Criticality Assessments 
  • Updated ‘Publish’ role in Risk & Criticality Assessments 
  • Create Recommendations without assessments with failure data
  • Enhancements to Reliability Assessments
  • Update on authorization with respect to Reliability Assessments 
  • Enable attribute-based authorization on Strategy Assessment for Classes
  • Efficiently manage your industrial system structure with new ‘Export and Import' options
  • Industrial system navigation with ‘Expand All’ and ‘Collapse All’ features
  • Download a pre-formatted Microsoft excel template to build a system hierarchy
  • Configure initial alert status and alert creation timestamps from rules
  • Enhancing rules with flexible user notifications
  • Multi-language support for rules attributes
  • Adding 4 new languages in SAP Asset Performance Management

Asset Risk Assessment

Assign failure mode to Risk & Criticality Assessments

Risk & Criticality Assessments are extended so that you can assign one or multiple  failure modes to each impact of a technical object to convey risk and potential failures. This enables you to run a failure mode centric paradigm in end-to-end asset management.

Key features

  • Display linked catalog profile in the Assignments tab.
  • Assign one or multiple failure modes against each impact assessed: Provides an F4 help selection field in the Assessments tab to select one or more failure modes per impact.
  • Apply To option: If all technical objects have the same catalog profile, the failure mode is assigned or copied only once when assessing multiple objects or when using the 'Apply To' option.

For more information, see Assessing Asset Criticality Based on the Risk Score.

Picture: When performing a Risk & Criticality Assessment, you can assign Failure Mode on each Impact by using F4 help.


Displaying additional details such as Maintenance Plant, Planning Plant on technical objects in Risk & Criticality Assessments 

Risk & Criticality Assessments now display additional details pertaining to the technical objects in the ‘Assignment’ tab. The additional details shown are

  • Technical Object Status
  • Equipment/Functional Location Category
  • Object Type
  • Structure in which the Technical Object is part of or installed
  • Maintenance Plant
  • Planning Plant

These additional details are also supported with ‘Export/Import’ of Risk and Criticality Assessments.

Updated ‘Publish’ role in Risk & Criticality Assessments 

We’re enhancing the authorization for Risk & Criticality Assessments. It is designed to differentiate the authorization on user roles so that it clear task separation is possible. Users with the RiskCriticalityAssessment_Publish  role can:

  • Release assessments.
  • Mark assessments as Obsolete.
  • Revert Obsolete status to previous state.


Asset Reliability Engineering

Assign failure data to Recommendations without assessments

We’re extending ‘Manage Recommendations’ application by enabling creation of Recommendations without assessments with failure data such as failure modes, failure effects and causes. This enhancement is part of our commitment to enable failure mode centric paradigm in end-to-end Asset Management.

Key features

  • Enable failure data assignment for recommendations created without assessments
  • Assign one or multiple failure modes, failure effects, and causes
  • Search, filter and list the recommendations based on failure modes

Enhancements on Reliability Assessments

We’re providing continuous enhancements on Reliability Assessments to improve usability. In release 2502, you can experience the followings. 

Key features

  • Support filtering of Strategy Assessment for Classes based on operating context and condition
  • UI improvement to Strategy Assessment for Classes (Similar to RCM/FMEA Assessments)
  • Provide free texts/notes while building failure data hierarchy in reliability assessments

Picture: You can filter Strategy Assessments for Classes per Operating Context and Condition.

Update on authorization with respect to Reliability Assessments 

After the 2505 release, the permissions for releasing assessments will change. Users with the FMEAAssessments_Create and FMEAAssessments_Update roles will no longer have access. Instead, users with the FMEAAssessments_Publish role will be granted the ability to release assessments. The same applies to RCM Assessment roles such as RCMAssessments_Create and RCMAssessments_Update. Strategy Assessments roles are affected in the same manner. You can read more details in SAP help. 

  • FMEAAssessments_Publish role: See 3567655 
  • RCMAssessments_Publish role: See 3567615 
  • StrategyAssessmentforClasses_Publish role: See 3567652

Enable attribute-based authorization on Strategy Assessment for Classes

‘Manage Strategy Assessment for Classes’ introduces attribute-based authorization based on ‘Planning Plant’ and ‘Maintenance Plant’ fields. This attribute-based authorization checks to ensure that information is only accessible to authorized users.

Key features

  • Update: Only users authorized for the specific Planning Plant and Maintenance Plant will be able to update these fields.
  • View: Users without authorization for the specific Planning Plant and Maintenance Plant combination will be able to view the assessment and recommendations. This allows you to review the information before deciding whether to proceed with copying.

This provides the necessary authorization and effective controls to support central and regional Strategy Assessment for Classes as Templates and Assessments.

Picture: Without having the relevant planning plant and maintenance plant assigned, it will not be possible to update the strategy assessment for classes. 

Asset Data and Information Management

Efficiently manage your industrial system structure with new ‘Export and Import’ options

Managing complex industrial system hierarchies is now easier than ever with our new Export and Import options available in the System Structure dropdown under the Structure tab. This functionality is designed to save time and enhance efficiency by streamlining the process of building and integrating system hierarchies.

Key Features

  • Export system structure: Build and export the hierarchy of your industrial systems. This feature allows for a structured and detailed view, facilitating the sharing and documentation of system configurations.
  • Import system structure: Seamlessly import existing industrial system hierarchies using Excel files. This capability ensures quick integration of system data, maintaining consistency and reducing manual entry errors.

Previously, building an industrial system required manually creating each system and its elements one by one. Now, with the 'Import System Structure' feature, the process is streamlined

  1. Initiating import
    Navigate to the 'Import System Excel' option, click 'Browse' to select your Excel file containing the system hierarchy details, and start the import process.
  2. Asynchronous processing
    The Job Manager handles the import asynchronously. You can track the status as 'In Process', 'Completed' or identify any issues if marked as 'Failed'. This transparency ensures you are informed of the process at each stage.
  3. Automatic system creation
    Upon completion, the system automatically creates the entire hierarchy using the imported Excel data. This includes all general information, language settings, plant details, and system elements. The tree structure with top nodes, functional hierarchies, products, and locations is compiled, offering a comprehensive view of the entire system.
  4. Verification and expansion
    Users can expand the hierarchy to view detailed node information and verify the accuracy of the imported data. This feature enables you to confirm that the system reflects the intended structure and details.

These export and import capabilities streamline system management, reduce errors, and save time, making it easier to maintain accurate industrial system hierarchies. For more details, see the SAP Help Portal Export or Import a System Structure.

Enhance industrial system navigation with ‘Expand All’ and ‘Collapse All’ features

Navigating through complex industrial system hierarchies has become simpler with our new Expand All and Collapse All buttons. These tools allow users to quickly view or minimize their entire system structure, enhancing efficiency and ease of navigation.

Key Features

  • Expand all and collapse all buttons
    These buttons, located in the structure tab, provide a quick and comprehensive view of your entire system hierarchy or simplify your workspace by collapsing all nodes. This is perfect for quickly locating specific system elements, especially after page reloads or re-navigation.
  • Seamless functionality with large data sets
    The system is designed to manage both small and extensive data hierarchies effectively, ensuring that users can expand or collapse structures effortlessly, even when handling a significant amount of data.

Picture: Please see above screen shot.

Download a pre-formatted Microsoft excel template to build a system hierarchy

Our latest feature simplifies the process of organizing and managing industrial system hierarchies through a downloadable, pre-formatted Microsoft excel template. Accessible via the "Download Template" button on the list page, this tool is designed to enhance efficiency and organization.

Key Features

  • Structured design: The template offers a structured approach to building a hierarchy of your industrial systems, ensuring consistency and accuracy across your data.
  • Comprehensive sheets: The Excel file includes multiple sheets to cover all aspects of your system's hierarchy:
    • System Header Details: Capture essential details of your system.
    • Top Node: Define the principal node of your hierarchy.
    • System Element Hierarchy (or Aspect Hierarchy): Organize the elements or aspects within your system.
    • Relationships (or Product Individual): Map out relationships or individual product details.
    • Product Individual: Detail each unique product within your hierarchy.

For more detailed guidance on managing industrial systems using the template, see the SAP Help Portal Manage Industrial Systems.

Asset Health Monitoring

Configure alert status and alert creation date from rules

‘Manage Rules’ in release 2502 introduces new enhancements designed to give you greater control over your alert workflows. With the latest updates, you now have the ability to configure the initial alert status and alert creation timestamp directly from your monitoring rules, making your processes more efficient and tailored to your needs. (* APM based on embedded IoT only)

Key features

  • Alert status customization
    With the new 'Alert Status' field, you can set whether alerts generated by a rule should begin in the 'New' status or 'In Process' status. This flexibility allows you to align alerts with your team’s workflow, ensuring that alerts are handled appropriately from the moment they're created. Based on this it is for example possible to create alerts in status 'In Process' right from the beginning in case a parallel notification has been created at the same time.

  • Control alert creation date
    The 'Alert Creation Date' feature gives you the power to specify the timestamp for alerts generated by rules. This control for example ensures that alert creation timestamps accurately reflect the timing of the conditions that triggered their creation, enhancing your ability to track and respond to events.

Picture: Use control + Space to get suggestions in the fields for Alert Status and Alert Creation Date. 

For detailed instructions on how to implement these features, see the SAP Help Portal Creating a Monitoring Rule

Enhancing Rules with flexible user notifications

We’re providing users with greater flexibility in receiving and managing notifications. The introduction of the "User Notification" feature is designed to streamline communication and improve workflow efficiency by providing customizable notification options for your rules.
(*APM based on embedded IoT only)

Key Features

  • Customizable notification body: Note in email notification’s body is fully customizable including dynamic values and hyperlinks. This flexibility ensures that emails convey the necessary context and details for recipients to take appropriate action.
  • Default email body include clickable hyperlinks to created alert and affected technical object.
  • Recipient selection: Users must select notification recipients from those maintained within the Identity provider associated with APM. This ensures alerts are directed to the correct individuals and maintains compliance with user management policies.
  • Flexible delivery options: Notifications can be delivered as FLP notifications or as emails, depending on user preferences. This flexibility allows users to choose the most convenient mode of alert delivery, enhancing usability and reducing notification fatigue.
  • User-controlled subscription: Users can manage their notification preferences, deciding whether to receive alerts as FLP notifications, emails, or a combination of both. This control over alert delivery ensures that users receive notices in a way that best fits their workflow and priorities.

Multi-language support for rules attributes

Our latest update provides a practical solution for organizations operating in multilingual environments by allowing users to translate all attributes used in rule conditions. This new feature supports several additional languages, including Italian, Indonesian, and Norwegian, among others.
(*APM based on embedded IoT only)

  • Improved accessibility: Translating data set attributes ensures that users can interact with rule conditions in their native languages, reducing misunderstandings and improving data management accuracy.
  • Enhanced collaboration: This update supports better collaboration among international teams by enabling everyone to work in their preferred language, fostering clearer communication and efficient workflows.

By clicking the translation button within the data set interface, users can easily add translations for rule condition attributes. This simple process helps tailor the system to meet diverse language needs, ensuring clarity for all team members.

 

Supporting 4 new languages across SAP Asset Performance Management

As mentioned above in Rules, more languages are added in SAP Asset Performance Management in the release 2502. This applies to all other apps across Asset Risk Management, Reliability Engineering, and Asset Data and Information Management. These languages will be supported in both short and long texts (UI & APIs), including Export / Import excel.

  • Norwegian
  • Dutch
  • Italian
  • Indonesian

This is the release highlights I prepared for the release 2502. Hope this provides you good overview. You can also refer to live webcast or recordings to get the details.

You can subscribe/register the webcast sessions as below.
SAP Digital Supply Chain Engagement Hub - Intelligent Asset Management & Field Service Management

Keep In Touch

Here's a quick reminder how to keep in touch with all things APM:

  • Check out all past and present Intelligent Asset Management webcasts here. If you register for an IAM webcast, you will be automatically subscribed to our IAM Community Engagement Newsletter. 
  • Check some of our recent blogs:
    • What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2501 - SAP Community
    • Why Failure-Mode Focus Matters in Intelligent Asset Management 
    • SAP Asset Performance Management Embedding Cumulocity IoT to Drive Innovations in IoT and AI
    • How AI-based Anomaly Detection empowers reliability engineers in SAP Asset Performance Management
  • Subscribe to What's New on the SAP Help Portal
  • Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session

entry.title: What`s New in SAP Asset Performance Management - Release 2502
entry.content:
SAP has introduced several new features in the latest Asset Performance Management (APM) 2502 release. In this blog, I will highlight the key features of SAP APM 2502 release.

To begin with, I would like to highlight the applications that underwent changes in the 2502 release.

  • Manage Industrial Systems
  • Manage Reference Designator Libraries
  • Manage Risk and Criticality Assessments
  • Manage FMEA Assessments
  • Manage RCM Assessments
  • Manage Strategy Assessment for Classes
  • Manage Recommendations
  • Manage Rules
  • Cross Product Capabilities

Mini Note: If you want to gain a deep understanding of Industrial Systems & Reference Designator Libraries, and how we can achieve sustainability by leveraging Industrial Systems, check out my latest blog through the link below.

Achieving Sustainability With SAP Asset Performance Management(APM) Through Industrial Systems 

Let us dive in...

Manage Industrial Systems:

  • Download a pre-formatted Microsoft Excel template to build a system hierarchy. 

The template includes Field List, System Header Details, Top Node, System Element Hierarchy, Relationships, and Product Individuals sheets.

Downloaded Template

 

  • Import or Export an Industrial System Structure.

  • Export Industrial System Structure: For instance, I would like to export "Calcination-Cooling Water Circulation System" hierarchy using dropdown option in the structure tab.

Now, let us take a look at the exported industrial system. The exported file looks like this.

System Details:

Top Node details:

Product hierarchy:

  • Import Industrial System Structure: For Instance, I would like to Import an Industrial System for " Reciprocating Air Compressor", i.e.

Let us fill out the downloaded template.

Industrial System Header Details:

Top Node: 

For this I am using three different Reference Designator Libraries for Functional, Product and Location Aspects.

Function Hierarchy:

Product Hierarchy:

Location Hierarchy:

Relationships:

Product Individual:

Now, let us upload the file using "Import Industrial Systems Excel" option.

Once the file is uploaded, we can check the import status using "Job Manager" application.

If no errors identified, system creates the structure and updates the status as "Completed".

If errors are cited, system provides the error log.

 

  • A Multi-Level Code displayed in product individual and system element node

A Multi-Level Code label appears when a child system element is selected. The code is displayed in a hierarchical format with two options:

  • Using dots (.) as delimiters. For Example: -B.A.A

 

  • If codes are reused, an index is shown, for example: -B.A.A[2]

 

  • Personalization using settings button to display selected values.

The settings button opens a dialog and displays selected values. We can deselect values as needed and choose save to apply changes. The saved settings will be loaded automatically when user logs in.

 

  • Enhanced Industrial System Statuses: The industrial system status management has been enhanced and we can:

Release Industrial System from "Created" state.

Mark a "Released" industrial system as obsolete.

Reopen a "Released" industrial system to create a new version, marking the previous version as obsolete

Restore an obsolete industrial system to "Released" status if a new version is not released.

Release a "Reopened" industrial system, marking the previous version as "Obsolete" and making the new version available for use.

  • Expand all and Collapse all buttons added.

These buttons give us a comprehensive view of entire Industrial System with one click.

  • Top Node Prefix.

The prefixing behavior for top nodes has been changed. The first top node now starts with a single prefix. For example, =, +, or - .

and subsequent top nodes increment the prefix. For example, - , -- , --- . For the product aspect " Kiln Feed Group System", i.e.,  "--"

 

Manage Reference Designator Libraries

  • Enhanced reference designator library statuses: The status management has been enhanced and we can: 

Release a reference designator library from the "Created" state.

Mark a "Released" reference designator library as "Obsolete".

Reopen a "Released" reference designator library to create a new version, making the previous version as "Obsolete".

Restore an "Obsolete" reference designator library to "Released" status if a new version is not released.

Release a "Reopened" reference designator library, making the previous version as Obsolete and making the new version available for use.

 

  • Enhanced object class code and delimiter support

Object class codes now support up to 5 letters ( Uppercase Latin letters A-Z, 0-9) and hierarchical structure separated by underscores.

 

  • New optional field Label in object class code.

A new optional "label" field has been added to the object class code to support industry specific coding standards. It enables users to add descriptive  labels to object class codes, providing additional context and clarity.

 

Manage Risk and Criticality Assessments

  • "RiskcriticalityAssessment_Publish" role: We can release RCA assessments, mark assessments as obsolete and revert Obsolete status to previous state.

  • Assign "Failure Mode" to risk and Criticality Assessment.

For instance, I have performed  Risk and Critically Assessment on Air Compressor and assigned a "Failure Mode - Moisture In Discharge Air".

Manage FMEA Assessments

  • Users with FMEAAssessment_Update role can not release assessments. Users with FMEAAssessment_Publish role will be granted the ability to release assessments.

Manage RCM Assessments

  • Users with RCMAssessment_Update role can not release assessments. Users with RCMAssessment_Publish role will be granted the ability to release assessments.

Manage Strategy Assessment for Classes:

  • A two-panel layout displays failure data and associated details side-by-side and a full screen mode option.

  • Technical Object assigned to recommendations are only accessible if the user belongs to both the assigned Planning Plant and Maintenance Plant. Users without authorization for the specific Planning Plant and Maintenance Plant combination will be able to view the assessment and recommendations.
  • We can search and filter Strategy Assessment for Classes based on operating contexts and conditions ; characteristics and values associated ; class ; Type

  • Users with StratgeyAssessmentforClasses_Update role can not release assessments. Users with the StrategyAssessmentforClasses_Publish role will be granted the ability to release assessments

Manage Recommendations:

  • Create standalone Recommendation with Failure Data. This enables linking a recommendation without assessment to the failure data model. We can assign the technical objects based on the selected failure data profile. Optionally, we can include failure modes, failure effects, and failure causes in the recommendation.

 

Manage Rules

Mini Note: The changes in the application "Manage Rules" apply only to SAP APM Embedded IoT. The SAP APM Embedded IoT Rule Management topics will be covered in a separate blog post.

Disclaimer: This blog does not cover Notifications , user notifications and Alerts for the rule output.

  • Configuration of Alert Status and Alert Creation Date from Rules: We can choose whether the alerts generated by a RULE should start as a "New" or "In Process". If we do not specify an alert status, then system considers the default status as "New". We can choose "1" for New and "10" for "In Process".

  • Rule Output Options: User Notification (This is an optional setting to have proactive alerts)

We can send emails to users if we configure SMTP Mail destination for email notifications. Activate "User Notification" in the rule out put section and use field "User Notification Body Header" to add relevant information to the email triggered through the user notification. We can configure the delivery method for user notifications either email or Fiori Launchpad (FLP) notification. 

Cross Product Capabilities

  • Legend option on the details page.

A legend option is available on Manage Strategy Assessment for Classes details page and Manage RCM Assessments and Manage FMEA Assessments.

The icons on Strategy Assessment for Classes represent operating context and Condition, Maintainable Items, and Failure Modes.

The Icons on RCM and FMEA assessments represent, Technical Object, Maintainable Item, Function, Functional Failure and Failure Mode.

Fact Sheet: The visual representation of icons vary from SAP APM "SIoT" to SAP APM "Embedded IoT"

 

  • Manage Language Translations  for Description and Long Text

We can view the maintained language translations in the "General Information Tab" and can add new translations using "Edit" mode.

 

  • Improved Search and Filtering on List Page with added fields.

To improve search and filter functionality, the fields, Changed By, Created By, Changed On and Created On were added to the list view and details pages of the applications Manage Recommendations, Implement Recommendations, Manage Industrial Systems and Manage Reference Designator Libraries.

Manage Recommendations Details Page

 

  • Notes For Asset Strategy Assessments: To provide specific context to assessments.

The RCM , FMEA, and Strategy Assessment for Classes  assessments allows to capture "Notes" on Functions, Functional Failures, Maintainable Items, Failure Modes, Failure Mechanism, Causes and Failure Effects. (Current Limitation: Functions and Functional Failures are not supported in Strategy Assessment For Classes.).

Mini Note: The assessment notes are stored within the SAP Asset Performance Management application. After adding the notes to failure data, the notes icon is highlighted, indicating that notes are available. We can update notes for assessments that are "In Process" but notes in "Released" assessments can not be edited.

 

😊This brings me to the end of my content walkthrough. I hope my blog proves useful to reliability management team. If you would like to keep up on SAP Asset Performance Management(APM), SAP Sustainability Control Tower(SCT), S/4 HANA Asset Management & SAP EHSM updates, follow me on SAP Community and LinkedIn.

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Usage of Catalogs, Code-groups & Codes in EAM Notification
entry.content:
Introduction:

Catalog is the customizing master data from Qulity Management (QM) application & in this blog I shall explain how the same is used in SAP Enterprise Asset Management application (henceforth it will be called as EAM) to describe the equipment’s problems through „code“ format (key that uniquely identifies the qualitative contents of a problem) in the „notification“.

Catalogs are created in the golden/customizing client & copied to other clients. It is used in various business processes of EAM to capture information related to maintenance history in the form of codes. Each code is assigned to a code group in the catalog. You can assign codes to different code groups. Catalog code and descriptions can be stored in a catalog.

There are many catalog codes delivered by SAP & we use only the following 5 catalog codes in the EAM application:

Sr.No.

Business Description

Catalog Codes

 SAP Description

1

Problems/Failures

C

Damage Overview

2

Causes of Damage

5

Causes

3

Tasks to be done

2

Tasks

4

Activities Completed

A

Activities (PM)

5

Sub – parts

B

Object Parts

Apart from these standard code groups, users are free to create own code groups as per their requirements in customizing client.

All the codes illustrate why an asset failed during production, what is the cause for that failure, tasks to be performed & activities done to overcome that failure. The use of codes in a SAP system ensures a consistent way of documenting the key aspects of the damage, cause, events etc. according to pre-defined categories. Few examples of „codes“ for „cause“ code-group are:

  1.         Breakage
  2.         Corrosion
  3.         Imbalance
  4.         Misalignment
  5.         Overheating
  6.         Vibration       

Catalog profile will group different characteristics of the notification, which will cater the needs of management to analyse the company assets & to ascertain the decisions accordingly. Catalog profiles have sub-class of multiple codes groups which will group/merge multiple codes as per their features. This is used for the damage analysis.

Transactions:

QS41 & 43: Maintain Catalog. Create new code groups & codes.

QS42: Display Catalog.

Working example:

Catalog codes are maintained in customizing – SPRO:

TA: S_ALR_87001010_1: Create own catalog & maintain the same. Catalog names 0 to 9 & A to O are used/assigned by SAP. You are free use catalog types P to Z.

Next step is to create code groups & codes under the catalog in TA: QS41 & maintain them. Example shown here is for catalog type „object parts“  (B).

Status of the code group should be „released“ to use.  

Now, maintain the codes for the created code-groups.

In this example, we created catalog codes, code groups & codes only for the „object parts“ code-group. Similarly, create codes for all the code-groups of all the catalog-codes.

Next step is to assign the created catalog to catalog profile & in-turn assign the catalog profile will be assigned to „notification“ type so that these codes will be displayed in the notification screen (TA: IW21) only of that notification type.

Maintaining catalog profile is done in SPRO:

User can use the TA: OQN6 for the same.

Assign the catalog & its code-group to catalog profile.

Note that you can assign any code groups (which is assigned to other catalog’s also) & a catlog profile can have multiple catalog codes.  

Assign this catalog profile to notification type (M1) in the SPRO:

 

Notification type can have only one notification profile.

Let’s see how it works while creating the notification (type M1).

Use TA: IW21 to create a notification with type M1.

You can see the values of F4 help of Object Part (catalog code = B): the one which we created in earlier steps & assigned (PM1 missed out) to catalogs profile will be displayed. The additional sub-screen „item“ section in the notification home screen & also the new tabs: „item“, „task“ & „activities“ can be added as shown in below.

To accommodate these (screen) changes in the notification screen, you need to change or add the new section in the customizing of notification type:

For the tab01, add new „item“ section.  Include other new tabs for items, task & activities.

Kindly note that these catalogs & code groups can be assigned only to „notification“ in plant maintenance.

Reports

Earlier LIS reports: MCI5 & MCI7 are used to analyse the data w.r.t code-groups & codes. In SAP S/4 HANA, SAP recommends to use the SAP Fiori app „Technical Object Damages“ for the same.

Migration:

These catalogs can be migrated (migration object: S4_QM_CATALOG_CODE) to SAP S/4 HANA system using the BAPI: BAPI_QPGR_SAVEREPLICA. Required authorization object is Q_CAT_GRP.

entry.title: Process-Driven Innovation and Excellence: How AsInt Leverages SAP Signavio
entry.content:
Preface

In today's fast-paced digital landscape, businesses must operate with agility, precision, and efficiency. Designing optimal business processes is key to achieving operational efficiency in any business. However, as businesses evolve and real-world challenges, events, scenarios emerge, teams often adapt their workflows to address specific situations. Over time, some of these adaptations become standard practice, sometimes leading to inefficiencies. Organizations that continuously refine their processes and proactively minimize these inefficiencies can sustain a competitive edge in the market.

When sub-optimal processes become the norm, inefficiencies and bottlenecks can be difficult to detect. A manager may sense productivity issues but lack the data needed to drive improvements, making process optimization a challenge. This is where process mining proves invaluable, providing business leaders with data-driven insights to uncover hidden inefficiencies, enhance performance, and reduce resource wastage.


Process modelling and mining leverages event logs from information systems to uncover insights, track performance, and enhance workflows. By analysing digital footprints, it provides a clear view of operations, helping organizations identify deviations, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement.

Introduction: The Power of Process-Driven Innovation

For AsInt, Inc., a leader in Asset Performance Management (APM) solutions, aligning business processes with customer needs is critical and of paramount importance. This is where SAP Signavio plays a pivotal role.

SAP Signavio is an industry-leading Business Process Management (BPM) suite that enables organizations to map, optimize, and transform business workflows with a data-driven approach. At AsInt, we integrate and utilize Signavio into our daily operations—ranging from product development cycles to customer consulting services and project implementation engagements—ensuring that every asset management centric process is streamlined, customer-focused, and continuously improving.

SAP Signavio in Action at AsInt

1. Driving Agile and Efficient Product Development

Developing next-gen solutions, such as our Asset Intelligence Suite for asset strategy build and mechanical integrity function, mobility tool for inspections, maintenance spend planning for OPEX/CAPEX budget optimization requires an in-depth understanding of industry best practices and workflows, regulatory compliance, and customer pain points. SAP Signavio allows our multiple teams to:

✔️ Map End-to-End Product workflows – From ideation to product deployment, we document every phase to ensure transparency and alignment with customer needs.
✔️ Simulate Business Scenarios – We use Signavio’s capabilities to evaluate different approaches and business processes variants before finalizing product features.
✔️ Ensure Regulatory Compliance and adherence to Industry best practices and standards – Our solutions must adhere to industry standards (e.g., API 581 for RBI, ISO 55000 for asset management). SAP Signavio helps us integrate compliance checkpoints into our workflows.

2. Enhancing Customer Consulting with Process Excellence

For AsInt, customer consulting is more than just providing solutions and software tools—it’s about empowering clients with best practices and industry standards knowledge and understanding along with industry peer’s processes as well. SAP Signavio helps us deliver structured, process-driven engagements by:

📌 Analysing Existing or AS-IS Business Processes – We work with customers to model their current asset management workflows and identify inefficiencies.

📌 Co-Designing Optimized Workflows and Processes – Using SAP Signavio’s collaborative features, we help customers design future-state processes tailored to their operational goals.

📌 Driving Digital Transformation – Whether it's a greenfield asset strategies development process or evergreening and continuous improvement process or even AsInt and SAP APM software product Implementation, we align our consulting efforts with best-in-class process methodologies.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2503
entry.content:
Here are the latest features released for SAP Asset Performance Management in 2503. We are pleased to announce significant updates, including Visual Asset Health Monitoring. This release also includes improvements to Manage Rules, Manage Alerts, and Manage Recommendations. 

Asset Health Monitoring

Enable Visual Asset Health Monitoring

SAP Asset Performance Management 2503 enables Visual Asset Health Monitoring. You can elevate your asset management strategy with AI-powered visual inspections.

By collecting and analyzing images of your assets, you can gain real-time insights into their health and predict potential failures before they occur. By documenting asset condition over time, Visual Asset Health Monitoring provides valuable insights into an asset's health and performance. Using AI-powered image analysis, it is possible to measure wear and predict potential failure with greater accuracy. Analyzing images can help identify issues before they lead to operational disruptions. This allows for timely alerts and maintenance notifications, preventing costly downtime and ensuring optimal asset performance. 
(*This is applicable for embedded IoT only)

Key benefits

  • Provides insights into asset health and performance
  • Uses AI-powered image analysis to measure wear and predict potential failure
  • Helps identify issues before they cause operational disruptions
  • Enables timely alerts and maintenance notifications
  • Prevents costly downtime and ensures optimal asset performance
  • Offers potential for improved efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness compared to manual inspections

For how to leverage Visual Asset Health Monitoring: see Visual Asset Health Monitoring | SAP Help Portal
You can also watch this video : End to end demo of Visual Inspection for Condition Monitoring.

Initiate Rule on-demand

You can now initiate a rule on-demand at any point of time, without having to wait for the automated run of the rule as per configurations. This would be helpful to perform a testing after setting a new rule or changing a rule. To do so, select the desired rule that is in Active status and click on the Run Rule Now button. This button is disabled when you select a rule that is not in active status. Read more on Triggering a rule (*This is applicable for embedded IoT only)

There are more enhancements with Rules. 

  • Manage Rule Runs API: The API is enhanced to view rule execution results, including errors, rule details, activation, execution, and involved technical objects. For more information, see Manage Rule Runs API.
  • Initiate Rule through API: To trigger a monitoring or a derivation rule only via API, you can choose the API only option in the Settings. For more information on the API, see Manage Rule Runs API in the SAP Business Acceleration Hub. Triggering a rule through the API can only be performed on-demand.

Navigate to Origin - Rule from Monitor Alerts 

Monitor Alerts in 2503 has been enhanced with a new feature that allows users to easily navigate to the Origin-Rule of alerts. Users can now click on a hyperlink associated with each alert to view the Rule that generated it. This enables quick checks of how Rules are defined and configured so that users can more efficiently investigate and understand why specific alerts are being triggered. (*This is applicable for embedded IoT only)

Asset Reliability Engineering

Configure filter options for priority type in Recommendations

Configuring priority filters in recommendations ensures that users can focus to prioritise the most important tasks, improving decision-making and efficiency. You can activate or deactivate priority types using the Recommendation Settings in the Configuration Manager application. The configured settings will then be reflected in the Manage Recommendations and Implement Recommendations applications, allowing users to filter and manage recommendations based on priority levels.

Enhanced visibility of lifecycle status in Recommendations

In asset management, understanding the lifecycle status of assigned technical objects, maintenance plans, and task lists is crucial for effective decision-making. To improve visibility, recommendations now display lifecycle statuses of these objects, ensuring that potential conflicts are identified and addressed promptly.

Warning icons for quick Identification
To make it easier to spot conflicts , warning icons have been added to both the Recommendation list page and object page. These icons appear in the following scenarios:

  • Technical Objects: If one or more assigned technical objects are with statuses deletion flag or deletion indicator.
  • Maintenance Plans: If a maintenance plan has a frequency mismatch or is in Object Deactivated, Deletion Flag, or Deletion Indicator status. 
  • Task Lists: If a task list has a status other than “Released (General)” or “Released for Order”.

Visual Cues in the Assignments Tab 
Beyond warning icons, visual cues in the Assignments tab help users quickly assess lifecycle status at a glance. By integrating these enhancements, users can efficiently manage assets, reducing the risk of overlooked issues or conflicts, ensuring that recommendations align with the current state of technical objects, maintenance plans, and task list.

  • Technical Objects flagged with a deletion flag or deletion indicator are visually highlighted.
  • Task Lists with a status other than “Released (General)” or “Release for Order”.
  • Maintenance Plans affected by a frequency mismatch, Object Deactivated, Deletion Flag, or Deletion Indicator status are distinctly marked. 

This is the release highlights I prepared for the release 2503. Hope this provides you a good overview. See below for a quick reminder how to keep in touch with us.

entry.title: Exploring SAP ERP: A Complete Guide to Key Modules and Business Processes
entry.content:
SAP ERP Modules Explained

Initially, when I coming to know SAP, I had no idea about ERP, MM, SD, FI, etc. So, I took the time to learn these concepts, and that's why I’d like to share what I’ve learned. I believe this will definitely be helpful for understanding how ERP works. SAP ERP is an enterprise resource planning system that integrates core business processes across Organization. This blog covers an overview of SAP ERP core modules and concepts ideal for both beginners and professionals looking to refresh their knowledge.

ERP Module Categories

Technical Modules

Technical modules involve the development of SAP modules, which can be categorized as standard or custom. Standard modules can be extended based on requirements, and custom modules can be developed to meet new requirements. This process includes designing the system architecture.

Functional Modules

Function Modules are between the end user and business which I elaborate in below 

Master Data vs Transactional Data

  • Master Data: This is static data like customer, material, or supplier records.
  • Transactional Data: This is a dynamic data which changed constantly for every transaction like purchase orders, sales orders, and invoices. For both master and transactional data below is the example and what they record during the process.

Understanding SAP Clients

A Client that Holds the separate system for the different scenario like development, quality, production, sandbox, support, Quality for support and they name it as different as D52, P52 etc. it differs from organization to organization.

Types of SAP Clients:

  1. Production – Live environment
  2. Quality Assurance (QA) – For testing
  3. Development - For developing 
  4. Sandbox – For experimentation
  5. Training – For end-user training

SAP Security Roles

Security has complete control over who can access what, and they have the sole authority to make those decisions. For example, developers cannot access every transaction available in SAP Logon they have certain restrictions.

Access Control Can Be Based On:

  • Company Code
  • Plant
  • Sales Organization
  • Transaction Codes (allowed or denied)
  • Launchpad Tile (allowed or denied)

Key SAP Modules and What They Do

1️ SAP Financial Accounting (FI)

It captures every financial transaction across and within the organization. It helps manage financial records and supports the business in financial decision making.

General Ledger

  • It this every crucial part that holds financial information such as Bank statement and balance sheet like database.

Accounts Payable (AP)

  • It manages the payment for suppliers and records the financial activity between supplier and organization.
  • It handles credit memos, invoices, and reporting

Accounts Receivable (AR)

  • It manages the money that comes into the company, for example, customer payments for a car.

Asset Accounting

  • Fixed asset that used throughout the organization for managing the company example chairs, laptops etc.
  • The lifecycle of entire Asset Accounting is acquisition, depreciation and Retirement. Acquisition is records the purchase of machinery, lease the building etc., depreciation is calculation decrease period the purchased asset for the company and retirement is disposing the Asset.

Bank Accounting

  • It helps to Manages bank statements, payments, and reconciliation.

Procure to Pay (P2P):

Procure to Pay (P2P) is an end-to-end business process that begin with purchasing goods and services and ends with vendor payment. It integrates procurement process and finance functions, ensuring purchasing operations and timely supplier payments to record. It starts with a Purchase Requisition, which is a request for goods and services. After that, an order is created and the material is dispatched. Once the item is dispatched, it must be received in the inventory, and the system should be updated with the details of what materials and how many units were received. After that, the invoice is collected, and finally, the payment is processed.

In SAP, P2P is primarily handled through the MM and FI where procurement process is managed and Payments are processed.

2️ SAP Controlling (CO)

It handles overall cost spending of the company that tracks internal costs, internal project, external project cast and monitors company spending etc.

Key Components:

  • Profit Centre Accounting: It tracks profit of the organization 
  • Cost Centre Accounting: It Monitors departmental expenses
  • Internal Orders: It tracks cost of the internal project
  • Product Costing: It calculates the cost of the product.
  • Profitability Analysis: Analysis the profit based on the region and customer

Record to Report (R2R)

The below image provided the Record to Report (R2R) process in SAP operations. R2R refers to the end-to-end process of recording transactions, closing financial periods, and generating reports for stakeholders. It records the every transaction and report the transaction finally.

It provides a structured approach to capturing the business transaction, Jornal Entries and sub ledger updates, Month end year end closing activities, financial report of balance sheet and tax reports, check accounting accuracy, closing books efficiently, and reporting. 

3️ SAP Sales & Distribution (SD)

Sales Distribution it very essential part of sales process it track from sale of the car to billing by the customer.

It initiates with the pre-sales process, which involves inquiries about the product and receiving quotations. After that, the customer decides whether to proceed with the purchase. Once confirmed, a sales order is created. After finalizing contracts and agreements, the process moves to the delivery stage. Required documents are prepared, items are picked from inventory, packed, and shipped to the specified address. Finally, the order is billed based on the invoice, payment is received, and the order is considered dispatched.

Integration Example:

The sales part integrate with both FI and MM part 

  • Sales Order Creation
    • Checks stock availability in MM
    • Runs credit checks in FI

4️ SAP Material Management (MM)

It insures the material availability throughout the lifecycle.

Procurement Lifecycle:

Material procurement in SAP MM (Materials Management) encompasses the complete lifecycle of acquiring goods and services from external suppliers, using MM we can manage all procurement activity. SAP MM equips organizations with tools to streamline and manage procurement activities efficiently. Below is a simple steps involved:

  1. Initiating Purchase Requisition (PR) - It is the process that creating purchase requisition as an internal request to procure the goods and services. It can be either manually or automatically based on availability.
  2. Issuing Request for Quotation (RFQ) - If it external an RFQ is generated and sent to selected vendors it helps to prepare RFQ to suppliers.
  3. Evaluating Vendor Quotations
    Once vendors respond, quotations are evaluated within SAP MM If it external an RFQ is generated based on some criteria like cost, quality and time taken for delivery.
  4. Creating Purchase Order (PO)
    Once vendor selection is completed, a purchase order is created containing all procurement detail such as quantity, pricing, delivery schedule, and payment terms.
  5. Recording Goods Receipt (GR)
    Delivery, a goods receipt is entered in SAP MM. This step confirms receipt and automatically updates inventory levels. It records every detail about the goods.
  6. Invoice Verification
    Following the Good Receipt, the vendor submits an invoice. SAP MM supports three-way matching  invoice, Purchase order, Goods Receipt to validate before forwarding it for payment.
  7. Processing Payments
    Verified invoices are handed off to SAP FI for payment processing, ensuring vendors are paid as per agreed terms also records any money balance.
  8. Vendor Performance Evaluation
    Visit the vendor’s location to evaluate the quality and safety standards and determine whether to continue working with the vendor in the future.
  9. Maintaining Material Master Data
    It has complete data of vendors such as vendor details, and pricing is crucial throughout the procurement process.
  10. Utilizing Reports & Analytics
    SAP MM offers powerful reporting tools to track procurement performance and identify the place to optimize and efficient.

 Inventory & Physical Stock Management:

  • Physically goods are stored and managed here.

Source to Pay (S2P):

Source to Pay (S2P) is a process for finding and managing suitable suppliers to purchase goods and services. It involves supplier identification and providing the RFQ. Once bid evaluation is completed, contract negotiation begins, and the requisition is approved. After that, a purchase order (PO) is created, goods receipt (GR) is generated, inventory is updated, and finally, the invoice is verified and payment is processed.

5️ SAP Production Planning (PP)

SAP Production Planning (PP) module is used to help plan manufacturing for sales and distribution of products.

.

 Manufacturing Types:

  • Repetitive Manufacturing: products stay the same over a long period of time
  • Discrete Manufacturing:  product is customize or change frequently

Key Components:

  • Bill of Materials (BOM): Complete list of the material and assemblies needed to manufacture a product
  • Routing: routing used for finished or semi-finished product calculate operation cost for finished product.
  • Capacity Planning: Used to balance production across different work centre.
  • Material Requirement Planning (MRP): Ensures material is available, key feature of MRP is that when it run, it will create procurement proposals. It ensures production can happen to meet our demand and it minimize the cost of holding too much unnecessary inventory.

6️ SAP Quality Management (QM)

SAP Quality Management deals with managing quality throughout a company’s processes.

Key Processes:

  • Quality Inspection: determine if the units inspected meet defined quality requirement.
    • Unit quality is measured.
    • Result and defect recording
  • Quality Control: Preventive, Monitoring and corrective actions
  • Quality Notifications: It involves in Record poor quality of internal or external issues. It can be created anywhere in the product cycle. This includes incoming inspection when a product has been purchased externally and final inspection before sending finished products out to our customers. It measures and monitor the quality against

7️ SAP Plant Maintenance (PM)

SAP Plant maintenance to manage the equipment and infrastructure of the plant.

Inspection: Measures condition of a production area.

Preventive maintenance: Maintains condition of a production area.

Repair: Restore condition of a production area.

8️ SAP Project System (PS)

SAP Project System that enables companies to manage all projects, large or small scale throughout the project lifecycle. It includes project planning, execution and completion.

Internal financed projects – funded by company themselves.

External financed projects – sponsored by clients and are executed to meet client requirement.

Key components of PS:

  • WBS (Work Breakdown Structure)
    • Shows amount of work
    • Shows how long.
    • Shows cost involved.
  • Once work breakdown is calculated, we’re able to accurately begin process planning, cost planning, scheduling and date and capacity planning.

9️ SAP Human Capital Management (HCM)

SAP HCM is a comprehensive solution designed to Manage all human resource and all these functions rely on organizational management.

Organizational Management: Where organizational populated, with different areas, position, and employee names.

Employee Administration: Which handle employee address, bank details and tax information.

Time Management: To record attendance, shift management and leave.

Benefits Management: Where companies can create their own unique benifit packages.

Recruitment: Includes Application tracking and reporting.

Learning Management: It helps enable online training and to track the completion of course by employees.

SAP Navigation for End Users

Clients

  • Different clients = different environments (e.g., 100, 110 etc…)

Transaction Codes (T-Codes)

  • Shortcut commands for SAP tasks
  • Ending with:
    • 01: Create
    • 02: Change
    • 03: Display
  • Starting with:
    • Y or Z: Custom codes
  • /n → Open transaction in the same session
  • /o → Open transaction in a new session

Conclusion: The SAP Advantage – Integration and Efficiency Across Functions

SAP ERP modules are the principal of enterprise systems, integrating various business processes across organization. Whether it's managing FI (Financial Accounting), MM (Material Mangement), SD (Sales and Distribution) Modules and etc. Processes like Source to Pay (S2P), Procure to Pay (P2P), Record to Report (R2R) and Order to cash (O2C) demonstrate the inter connection of strategic and operational activities within an organization. With SAP’s modular approach, businesses can achieve efficiency process the overall lifecycle of the product so and so, accuracy, and transparency across their procurement and finance functions. By understanding the process and how it works throughout the organization, you can make decisions based on the data collected during the process, which increases the performance of the organization.

  • Manage Reference Designator Libraries
  • Manage Industrial System Hierarchy
  • Manage Industrial System Configuration

These APIs enable full CRUD operations for key industrial system components, allowing customers to customize configurations, add new fields, and automate workflows. This boosts flexibility, speeds up system management, and supports seamless integration—delivering greater efficiency and control.

API Reference interface for managing Reference Designator Libraries

 

Industrial System Templates 

You can now create industrial systems from existing templates, streamlining setup and configuration. The new Manage Industrial System Templates app makes it easy to organize and reuse templates.

Enhanced Industrial System Views

 Industrial systems can now be viewed in both graph and table formats, giving you more flexibility in how you visualize and manage your asset hierarchies.

Here's a dedicated blog on the industrial system enhancements. Build Once, Reuse Often – New Features in Industrial Systems with SAP Asset Performance Management

 

Asset Reliability Engineering

Role-Based Assessment Release

 Only users with the appropriate “Publish” roles can now release RCM, FMEA, and Strategy Assessments, ensuring better control and governance. For more information, see 3567652 - SAP Asset Performance Management: Manage Strategy Assessment for Classes Authorization with 2505 release - SAP for Me

 

Lifecycle Management for Recommendations and Assessments

  • You can mark recommendations and strategy assessments as “Obsolete” to keep your data clean and up-to-date. Comments are required to provide context for these changes.
  • Authorized users can now reset released strategy assessments to “In Process” for further modifications, supporting continuous improvement.

 

Asset Health Monitoring

Device Connectivity Capabilities (Embedded IoT) 

APM now supports device management, available through the SAP Early Adopter Care (EAC) Program. This enables seamless integration and monitoring of IoT-connected assets. The EAC phase starts with a basic version that will gradually be enhanced. To obtain access to this feature, see Getting Early Adopter Access to New Features and Functions. 

For more information, see this blog SAP Asset Performance Management Embedded IoT: Device Management is available via EAC.

Detailed Long Text in Alerts (Embedded IoT) 

Alerts generated by rules now display detailed descriptions in the Long Text field, providing clearer context for both alerts and notifications.

 

Enhanced Visual Inspection Results (Embedded IoT)

 View images in full screen with linked measurements and easy navigation. Confirm or reject AI-generated indicators individually or in bulk for streamlined workflows.

 

Aggregation Rules for Technical Objects (Embedded IoT) 

Create aggregation rules to consolidate data from child technical objects into their parent objects. This helps summarize key indicators across assets, enabling quicker insights, easier monitoring, and better decision-making throughout your asset hierarchy.

 

Administration and Configuration

Data Synchronization Tab 

The Integration Monitor app now includes a left-side menu with a Data Synchronization tab, offering a clearer and more organized view of synchronization status and data metrics reports. This update lays the groundwork for a more structured interface, with plans for additional tabs and features in upcoming releases. For more information, see Data Synchronization.

 

 

 

Cross Product Capabilities

SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) Model Transition

As part of our effort to standardize the technology stack for SAP Asset Performance Management, we are currently in the process of transitioning our existing applications to the SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) model in a phased approach with different timelines per application. 

This transition includes the migration of the database from using GUIDs (32 characters) to UUIDs (36 characters). You can find more details in the SAP Note 3603407.

Improved Status Filtering for Technical Objects

 The Select Technical Objects popup now automatically excludes inactive, deleted, or marked-for-deletion objects, ensuring you work only with relevant, active assets.

 

Get Started

For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.

Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.

See you in the next release!

entry.title: Material Document Overview Fiori App features
entry.content:
Inventory Management:

  • Identifying and Addressing Stock Discrepancies: By quickly locating material documents related to unexpected stock level changes, warehouse managers can investigate potential mis-postings. This leads to more accurate inventory records and correct account updates. Sometimes, enhancements made to any logistics module can lead to incorrect postings of goods, even when there are no actual movements of those goods. We can identify such movements.
  • Optimizing Storage and Warehouse Layout: Analyzing the frequency and types of material movements can reveal bottlenecks or inefficiencies in warehouse layout and storage strategies. For example, frequently moved materials can be placed in more accessible locations.
  • Evaluating Inventory Turnover: By reviewing the history of goods issues for specific materials, businesses can assess their inventory turnover rate and identify slow-moving or obsolete stock, prompting decisions on markdowns or disposal.
  • Planning for Stock Transfers: Understanding past stock transfer patterns can help optimize future inter-plant or inter-storage location transfers, ensuring timely availability of materials where needed and minimizing transportation costs.
  • Assessing the Impact of Goods Receipts: Reviewing recent goods receipts helps confirm the timely and accurate arrival of purchased materials, allowing for proactive communication with vendors if issues arise.

Production Planning and Execution:

  • Troubleshooting Production Issues: If production orders face material shortages, the app can quickly show when and why the required materials were issued or if there were any unexpected goods issues that depleted stock.
  • Analyzing Material Consumption: Production planners can review plant-wise material consumption. Which plant consumes more material? When did the plant consume the material? We can observe consumption patterns. The production order number is a field on the selection screen where the user can track material consumption against a particular production order or a certain number range of orders.
  • Tracking Rework and Scrap: Material documents associated with rework or scrap can be easily identified, providing data for analyzing the causes and costs of quality issues. We have separate movement type for scrap which can help in tracking.

Procurement:

  • Verifying Goods Receipt Against Purchase Orders: Procurement teams can quickly check if goods receipts have been posted for their purchase orders, ensuring timely payment processing and vendor performance monitoring. GR can be tracked by movement type 101. Purchase order is a field available on the selection screen where the user can track the GR against a particular PO.
     
  • Investigating Discrepancies Between Ordered and Received Quantities: If there are discrepancies, the material documents provide the details needed to investigate with the vendor and resolve any issues.
     
  • Evaluating Vendor Delivery Performance: Analyzing the timeliness of goods receipts related to specific vendors can contribute to vendor performance evaluations.
  • Vendor return tracking: Vendor returns can be tracked separately with movement types 122 and 161.

Sales and Distribution:

  • Tracking Material Issues for Sales Orders: Customer service and logistics teams can quickly verify when goods were issued for specific sales orders, helping them respond to customer inquiries about shipment status. Movement type 601 can be used here.
  • Investigating Delivery Issues: If a customer reports a missing item, the material document overview can help trace the goods issue and identify potential errors in picking or shipping.
  • Analyzing Returns: Material documents related to customer returns offer analyses of the reasons for returns and the quantities involved, informing decisions on product quality or process improvements.
     

Finance and Accounting:

  • Reconciling Inventory Records: Accountants can use the app to verify the accuracy of inventory postings and reconcile physical inventory counts with system records.
  • Auditing Material Movements: The detailed audit trail provided by material documents is crucial for internal and external audits, ensuring compliance and financial accuracy.
  • Analyzing Material Costs: While this app doesn't directly display costs, the material document information is a key input for cost accounting processes, helping to track material consumption and value flow.

In essence, the "Material Document Overview" Fiori application empowers various business users to:

  • Gain immediate visibility of past and present inventory movements.
  • Check the consumption of material at the plant and storage level.
  • Identify and investigate anomalies or discrepancies in material flow.
  • Access the underlying details of material-related transactions.
  • Make data-driven decisions to optimize their specific processes and contribute to overall supply chain efficiency.

By providing easy access to this critical information, the app fosters a more proactive and informed approach to managing materials across the organization.

Post the successful integration of  S/4HANA system with SAP APM, all the technical objects in SAP Asset Performance Management, with one or more indicators, are automatically synchronized to Embedded IoT platform to enable time series data ingestion. If we need to know the synchronization status of one or more technical objects including indicators, we can use READ Public APIs. Also, we can use POST Public API to manually retrigger a sync to the underlying IoT platform for a specific technical object if needed before the automatic scheduler run.

Now, let me walk you through the POST public API to manually re-trigger the equipment "Submersible Pump-03, 1.5HP, 12 Stage" sync to the EIoT platform.

entry.title: What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management 2506
entry.content:
Welcome to the 2506 release of SAP Asset Performance Management (APM). 

This release brings two major innovations: native APM Transport Management powered by SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS), and the ability to seamlessly consume device data ingested via the Embedded IoT platform. 

You’ll also find smarter filtering options, clearer visibility into file uploads, and new OData APIs built on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) to support maintenance recommendations based on risk, criticality, functions, and failure modes.

And as a quick heads up we'd love you to join our new Customer Engagement Initiative Empowering Reliability: Data-Driven Maintenance Efficiency Analysis for Strategy Optimization. Collaborate with us and help us gather specific user needs and validate initial ideas for analytical tools, visualizations, and workflows that will form the foundation of a future solution! Register by July 26, 2025.

Let's take a look at release 2506.

Introducing APM Transport Management with SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS)

SAP Asset Performance Management now offers its own native transport management solution using the SAP BTP Cloud Transport Management Service (CTMS), replacing previous manual processes. This centralized service lets you efficiently move configurations and templates across your connected cloud environments.

You can access the CTMS via a new app called Transport Management.

Each system environment is represented as a node in CTMS, providing clear visibility and control over your transport landscape. Secure connections called destinations link CTMS to each tenant, while defined transport routes manage the flow of configurations to ensure data moves securely and in the correct order.

This new solution supports transporting key objects including:

  • Communication system configurations
  • Coding masks
  • Risk and criticality assessment templates
  • Strategy assessment templates for classes, including associated recommendations

To ensure smooth transports, all related SAP S/4HANA master data and dependencies should be synchronized and available in the target tenant before initiating transport.

For more information, see the SAP Help portal at:

  • Transport Management
  • Transport Communication Systems
  • Transport Coding Masks
  • Transport Strategy Assessment Templates
  • Transport Assessment Templates
  • Integration with SAP Cloud Transport Management service.

Watch this video to see it in action:

Smarter Filtering in APM: Failure Data Profile & Risk Score Type

Customers working with technical objects often face challenges when filtering equipment or understanding risk scores. We’ve introduced two key enhancements to improve usability and decision-making:

1. Failure Data Profile in Explore Technical Objects app

Within the Explore Technical Objects app, users can now filter more effectively using the Failure Data Profile:

  • Fuzzy search helps find matching failure patterns quickly.
  • A new column supports condition-based filtering.
  • Related technical objects are displayed instantly, making it easier to act on recurring issues.

2. Risk Score Type Filtering

Previously, risk scores were stored in mixed formats—numeric and alphanumeric—leading to sorting issues.

What’s new:
  • Users can now filter by risk score type for better clarity.
  • Sorting by ascending or descending scores works accurately.
  • Equipment without RC scores is also flagged, helping highlight missing data.

These enhancements make it easier to identify critical technical objects and understand their risk levels—supporting more effective reliability planning.

Embedded IoT - Availability of Device Connectivity Data

Ingest Data via Embedded IoT Platform provider and Consume it Seamlessly in APM

We've got great news for those working with connected assets: it's now possible to consume data in Asset Performance Management (APM) that was ingested via our Embedded IoT Platform provider.

This enhancement brings flexibility to customers using protocols like MQTT to send times series data for their assets. By leveraging embedded IoT capabilities, you can now use the data that is ingested via device protocols into the Embedded IoT provider platform in APM to support asset health monitoring, predictive maintenance, and intelligent decision-making. 

Why This Matters

Many industrial environments use lightweight messaging protocols like MQTT to collect telemetry data from machines, devices, and sensors. Embedded IoT makes it easy to ingest and process this data. Until now, this data was not yet made available for consumption in APM.

With this new capability, you can:

  • Ingest telemetry data via our embedded iot provider (e.g., using MQTT)
  • Benefit from automated data integration into APM without manual steps or interventions
  • Use APM features to monitor asset condition, define failure thresholds, and generate maintenance requests

Device connectivity data from the embedded IoT provider platform is now available in SAP Asset Performance Management for consumption as a part of the SAP Early Adopter Care Program. For more information, see Device Data Integration in SAP Asset Performance Management   To obtain access to this feature, refer to Getting Early Adopter Access to New Features and Functions.

This brief video shows how to map sensor time series to asset indicators using the Digital Twin Manager in SAP Asset Performance Management.

File Upload Status in the Integration Monitor

For customers using the Data Integration channel via File Uploads on Embedded IoT, the Integration Monitor offers a new File Upload Status page, enhancing transparency for the file upload feature introduced last year.

Together, these features provide tools to customize, visualize, secure, connect, and optimize your assets, turning complex data into clear insights and confident actions—so your assets perform at their best. 

New OData APIs as part of the CAP transition

As part of the transition to the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), we’ve introduced new OData APIs to support more flexible and future-ready integrations. These APIs are designed to help determine maintenance recommendations based on risk, criticality, functions, and failure modes. See https://api.sap.com/api/recommendationOdata/overview

 

Stay Informed and Get Involved

  • For an exhaustive list of all new features, visit the SAP Help Portal - What's New in SAP Asset Performance Management.. 
  • Submit or vote for the improvement you would like to see in the SAP Continuous Influence session.
  • Collaborate with us! Don't forget to register by July 26, 2025 for our new Customer Engagement Initiative Empowering Reliability: Data-Driven Maintenance Efficiency Analysis for Strategy Optimization. We'd love to have you on board! 

See you in the next release!

entry.title: SAP Asset Performance Management - Ingesting Time Series Data - Derivation & Monitor Rule Management
entry.content:
This blog outlines the steps involved in ingesting time series data using the File Upload API method into SAP Asset Performance Management(APM) and processing the time series data using  Rule Management - Derivation and Monitor Rules.

The time series data plays a crucial role in estimating asset health and risk. For condition-based maintenance of assets, SAP APM application reads the time series data from IoT. There are various methods to ingest time series data into SAP APM, including:

  • Manual Insertion of Indicator Values in SAP APM
  • SAP S/4HANA Measurement Documents
  • File Upload API
  • Measurements API

For processing time series data with rules, SAP APM supports the rule types listed below:

  • Monitoring Rule: A rule which operates on a designated schedule.
  • Derivation Rule: A rule which takes data from a technical object and uses formula to calculate a new value for another indicator of the same technical object.
  • Aggregation Rule: A rule which allows to use one indicator which is common across all subordinate technical objects, and aggregate it up to an indicator of the parent technical object.

Ingest Time Series Data using File Upload API:

The following public APIs  are available for ingesting time series data.

  • File Upload(POST API): It enables maintenance team to create time series data from a source file (.parquet format). This API creates IoT time series data for a combination of technicalObjectNumber, technicalObjectType, SSID, positionID, and categoryName wwithin a particular time range.
  • File Status(READ API): It enables maintenance team to retrieve the status (received, scanned, processed) of the uploaded file using the file ID. 

Mini Note: As part of the June 2025 release, SAP APM has introduced a new IoT data integration feature in the Integration Monitor application to track the real-time processing status of uploaded files through clear progress updates and status indicators. In this blog, I will focus on the new IoT data integration feature instead of  FILE Status (READ API).

Define Scope Analysis is the starting point of the process. It sets the boundaries for analyzing the asset.
